column4: i use asus laptop and ubuntu 10.10 lts but when I plug in my headphone i hear nothing
how can i fix it
do you use gnome?
yes
hmm, i'm from the kde side, but try this: start up a terminal and enter alsamixer
then press F5
you should see the different mixers do you?
: 2nd column is speaker
hmm
usually alsamixa in commandline is the most basic thing to work with, and afaik kmix and other gui-sound-mixers are just infterfaces for alsa.
if you don't see headphones, it might me a driver problem, but i can be a simpler reason
i allready saw some driver problems, but i never heard about problems with headphones
so nothing that reminds of headphones? make the window as big as possible and be sure you pressed the key 'F5' to show all mixers
use left and right key to navigate between the mixers
is it a fresh install?
did it work before?
then you must have changed something
i know, this is a M$-advice, but anyways: did you restart?
: i'm not sure
but i tried to adjust alsamixer as you told me before

it can not be a driver problem, because then i the headphones should never have worked then. you also didn't mute them, because the you would see them in alsa mixer. so i don't know anyfurther, sorry. one last thing: try to put all mixers to maximum and test again
it happened to me onece, that i was not able to use the mic. i found, that i had to put an extra mixer up to enable mic.
what puzzles me is that you don't see a headphone mixer
: my laptop has one line in for headphone and mic
